title: 'I have come to surrender': Bengaluru man beheads wife after fight over affair
content: In a shocking incident in Bengaluru, M Shankar surrendered to Suryanagar police, carrying his wife S Manasa's severed head on his scooter. He confessed to killing her after a dispute over an alleged affair. The couple, both factory workers, had a three-year-old daughter. Neighbors reported hearing a violent altercation before the gruesome act.

title: Trump warns Musk of 'very serious consequences‚Äô if he backs Democrats
content: Donald Trump has warned Elon Musk of ‚Äúserious consequences‚Äù if he supports Democrats following a fallout over the GOP's budget bill. The rift began after Musk criticized the bill, leading to Trump expressing disappointment and accusing Musk of disrespect. Musk retaliated by calling for Trump's impeachment and reviving old allegations.

title: 'We were stuck for nearly 40 minutes': 62-year-old Delhi tourist dies in Mussoorie
content: A Delhi man died in Mussoorie due to a suspected heart attack, exacerbated by severe traffic and ambulance unavailability. His family struggled for over an hour to cover a short distance despite police escort. The incident highlights Mussoorie's traffic crisis and ambulance shortage, with only a few ambulances serving the Dehradun region.

title: Tech jobs: Microsoft CEO's advice for Computer Science students; All of us..
content: Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella advises aspiring tech professionals to prioritize computational thinking fundamentals, even with AI's growing influence. He emphasizes the importance of logically breaking down problems and designing systematic solutions. Nadella also revealed that AI now contributes significantly to Microsoft's code, writing up to 30% of it.

title: Manipur suspends internet for five days in five districts amid unrest
content: Manipur government has suspended internet services in five districts, including Imphal West and East, for five days due to escalating law and order concerns. This decision follows protests sparked by the arrest of an Arambai Tenggol leader, alongside intensified security operations that led to the arrest of militants and recovery of weapons. The state remains tense amidst ongoing ethnic conflict.

title: 'Riots, looters...will be solved': Trump deploys 2k troops as LA unrest grows
content: President Trump threatened federal intervention in Los Angeles due to protests against immigration raids, criticizing Governor Newsom and Mayor Bass. Clashes escalated in Paramount as agents deployed tear gas, leading to arrests, including union leader David Huerta. Senator Schumer condemned Huerta's arrest, alleging suppression of free speech, while Homeland Security vowed prosecution for obstructing law enforcement.

title: 'Can't play as impact player': Kohli's statement sparks speculation - was he targeting someone?
content: After Royal Challengers Bengaluru's historic IPL victory in 2025, Virat Kohli's remarks ignited widespread discussion. Following RCB's final win against Punjab Kings, Kohli emphasised his commitment to all-round contribution. He stated his desire to give his all on the field until he retires, highlighting his aversion to being just an 'impact player'.

title: Too many emails? Google AI CEO says he‚Äôd pay big to get rid of them: ‚ÄòThe thing‚Ä¶'
content: Google DeepMind CEO Demis Hassabis is developing an AI-powered email system to alleviate the burden of inbox management. Hassabis expressed his desire to eliminate emails, even at a high cost, and his team is actively creating a tool that sorts, replies, and ensures important messages are addressed.

title: Pakistan's demand to chair 4 UN terror-related panels snubbed, finally given only one
content: Pakistan's aspirations to lead multiple key UN Security Council terrorism-related committees have been largely unmet, securing only the chairship of the 1988 Taliban Sanctions Committee. Other UNSC members rebuffed Pakistan's demands for leadership roles, leading to delays in committee allocations. India views this outcome as a reflection of Pakistan's limited standing and credibility within the UN.

title: Bengaluru stampede: Cops had warned against feting RCB at legislature
content: A senior police officer's warning about security risks at RCB's IPL victory celebration was ignored, leading to a stampede that killed 11. The officer had cautioned against the event at Vidhana Soudha due to potential overcrowding and inadequate security. Political figures are now demanding accountability from top officials for allegedly rushing the event without proper safety measures, despite prior warnings.

title: Musk is back; Staff want him present at his companies; he became busy in politics
content: Elon Musk is back at Tesla, SpaceX, and X after serving in Washington. His absence impacted Tesla's sales and SpaceX's morale. He remained active with xAI and its chatbot, Grok. A Telegram partnership was teased but not finalized. Employees and investors want more than just symbolic gestures from Musk. They seek his active leadership to address challenges.

title: BRS MLA from Hyderabad's Jubilee Hills, Maganti Gopinath passes away
content: Maganti Gopinath, BRS MLA from Jubilee Hills, died on Sunday. He suffered a heart attack on June 5 and was under treatment. The three-time MLA was 62 years old. Gopinath started his political career with the Telugu Desam Party. He won as an MLA in 2014, 2018 and 2023. K Chandrasekhar Rao and other leaders expressed their condolences.

title: 'You need to come sit in dugout': Ponting to Preity Zinta, justifies aggressive nature on pitch
content: Despite the loss in the final to Royal Challengers Bengaluru, Punjab Kings earned praise for an impressive campaign under Ricky Ponting. The Australia legend opened up about his aggression during games and the way he switches back to being cool outside of cricket. PBKS co-owner Preity Zinta was handed a rare offer by the coach.

title: Thug Life day 3: Kamal Haasan film sees small uptick | Rs 30.15 crore collected
content: Mani Ratnam and Kamal Haasan's 'Thug Life' experienced a slow start at the box office, earning Rs 30.15 crore in India over three days. After a significant drop on Friday, Saturday showed a modest increase, fueled by Tamil Nadu occupancy, especially in Chennai. However, the film struggles in the Hindi belt, facing challenges in connecting with North Indian audiences due to underwhelming reviews.

title: 'Favourite city': Jadeja shares stylish pictures; Team India in England for Test series
content: Team India has arrived in London for the highly anticipated five-Test series against England, commencing June 20. Shubman Gill is set to captain the side for the first time in the longest format. Ravindra Jadeja shared photos on social media, showcasing his relaxed mood in London.

title: 'No red lines': Al-Qaeda Yemen threatens Trump, Musk; uses Gaza as rallying cry
content: Al-Qaeda's Yemen branch leader, Saad bin Atef al-Awlaki, threatened Donald Trump and Elon Musk over the Gaza conflict in his first public appearance since assuming leadership in 2024. He urged lone-wolf militants to assassinate leaders in Egypt, Jordan, and Gulf Arab nations, while the group seeks to reclaim relevance amidst the Houthi's growing popularity by portraying concern for Gaza.

title: IPL 2025: Patidar breaks tradition for Kohli after RCB win ‚Äî Watch the viral video
content: Following RCB's triumph in the IPL final, captain Rajat Patidar announced that the win was dedicated to RCB's trusted talisman Virat Kohli, who has been with the team since the start of the competition in 2008. The captain was also spotted breaking a tradition in the final and urged Kohli to take center stage in the celebrations.

title: Passport of Rajasthan staffer held for spying reveals 4 Pakistan trips
content: Rajasthan Police discovered Shakur Khan's passport, revealing multiple trips to Pakistan, including one in March 2025. Khan, an assistant administrative officer, is accused of aiding Pakistani visa applications and collaborating with a Pakistani official expelled from India. Over 25 individuals who received visa assistance are being interrogated as the investigation expands, focusing on Khan's espionage activities and connections.

title: Rahul's claims absurd, bring into disrepute Cong's own polling reps, say EC officials
content: Election Commission officials have strongly refuted Rahul Gandhi's claims of "fixing" the Maharashtra polls, dismissing them as absurd and disrespectful to the electoral process. The EC emphasized the transparency of the elections, highlighting the involvement of Congress's own booth level agents in the process.

title: Despite World Bank raising threshold, India achieves big dip in extreme poverty
content: Recent World Bank data reveals a significant decline in India's extreme poverty rate, dropping from 27.1% in 2011-12 to 5.3% in 2022-23, lifting nearly 270 million people out of extreme poverty. This reduction is attributed to updated poverty line definitions and improved household survey data. Free food transfers and a narrowing rural-urban poverty gap also contributed to this progress.

title: Commandos plan final assault on Maoist top guns in Abujmarh
content: Maharashtra's C-60 commandos are preparing for a final assault on Abujmarh, the Maoist headquarters, following the CM's visit. Simultaneously, Odisha police are intensifying searches in Sambalpur forests due to an influx of Maoists from Chhattisgarh. The operation aims to eliminate the Maoist presence, focusing on key leaders like Bhupathi and Kosa, who are evading capture in the challenging terrain.

title: Chenab river link: Besides engineering challenges, world's highest rail bridge overcame legal hurdles too
content: The construction of the world's highest cable-supported single-arch bridge on the Chenab River faced significant hurdles, including a series of Public Interest Litigations (PILs) filed in courts since 2008-09. These PILs challenged the project's alignment, cost, and methodology, causing delays.

title: Drug cartel's hawala cash trail ends in washing machine in Goa
content: Telangana Anti Narcotics Bureau busted an inter-state hawala racket linked to international drug cartels, seizing ‚Çπ50 lakh from a Goa flat, ready to be laundered to Nigeria. The investigation revealed that the key accused, Uttam Singh, laundered ‚Çπ2.1 crore of drug money in a week through informal channels, with funds ultimately destined for Nigeria.

title: Retired HC judge John Michael D'Cunha who convicted Jaya to probe Bengaluru stampede
content: Following the tragic stampede outside Chinnaswamy Stadium during RCB's IPL victory celebrations, the Karnataka government has appointed retired Justice John Michael D'Cunha to lead a probe, demanding a report within a month. Alongside judicial and magisterial inquiries, the CID has taken over the criminal investigation, seizing evidence and questioning KSCA staff.

title: ‚ÄòNo night stay‚Äô: Urs at Shivaji-era fort goes low-key after court restrictions
content: Amidst a sensitive environment, the Vishalgad Urs faces restrictions as the archaeological department prohibits it, citing the fort's protected status. Despite this, trustees affirm the Urs will proceed from June 8-10, adhering to high court orders and administrative guidelines. Heightened security measures are in place following warnings, with fort access limited to 9am-5pm, ensuring a low-key observance of traditional rituals.

title: Glucose in space: Ax-4 crew to play key role in diabetes study
content: The Axiom- mission (Ax-4) astronauts, including India's Group Captain Shubhanshu Shukla, are participating in the Suite Ride experiment, a medical study exploring glucose behavior and insulin stability in microgravity. This research aims to validate technologies that could potentially allow insulin-dependent diabetics to safely undertake spaceflight in the future.

title: India records 4 fresh Covid fatalities; toll rises to 59
content: India reported four new Covid-19 fatalities, including a pregnant woman, raising the year's death toll to 59 with 5,755 active cases. In response to rising cases and deaths, the central government is conducting mock drills to assess Covid preparedness. States are ensuring the availability of essential resources, while surveillance units monitor influenza-like illnesses and severe acute respiratory illnesses.

title: Hope steams up among Dharavi‚Äôs idli-makers over redevelopment plan
content: In the heart of Mumbai's Dharavi, women like Alaguthai Thangapandi are the unsung heroes, crafting fresh idlis daily to feed the city. Sourcing ingredients meticulously, they face challenges like poor infrastructure and monsoon disruptions. With the Dharavi Redevelopment Project underway, they hope for better kitchens and dignified living conditions to expand their culinary contributions.

title: Govt cracks whip on dark patterns, sets e-commerce companies 3-month deadline
content: The Central Consumer Protection Authority (CCPA) has instructed e-commerce platforms to conduct self-audits within three months to detect and remove 'dark patterns' that manipulate consumers. Platforms are encouraged to provide self-declarations confirming their compliance. A joint working group has been established to monitor violations and promote consumer awareness.

title: Contraceptive pills linked to heart attack in young woman with PCOS
content: Payal, a 27-year-old Mahim resident, experienced a heart attack, shocking her family due to her age and the perceived protection women have during childbearing years. Doctors identified contraceptive pills, prescribed for her polycystic ovary syndrome (PCOS), as the likely culprit.

title: Can't club terror-backers with victims: EAM Jaishankar to UK's Lammy
content: External Affairs Minister Jaishankar conveyed to UK's David Lammy India's firm stance against equating perpetrators of terrorism with its victims, emphasizing zero tolerance. Lammy condemned the Pahalgam attack and pledged support against cross-border terrorism. Discussions also covered the India-UK Free Trade Agreement, deepened strategic partnership, and enhanced cooperation across various sectors, including trade, defense, and technology.

title: Assam to revive 1950 law to oust illegal migrants sans court order
content: Assam government is set to utilize the Immigrants (Expulsion from Assam) Act, 1950, to expedite the deportation of illegal migrants without judicial intervention. This decision follows a Supreme Court constitutional bench's observation that the Act remains valid, empowering district commissioners to order immediate pushbacks.

title: ICICI manager ploughed Rs 4.6 crore customer funds into stocks, held
content: Sakshi Gupta, an ICICI Bank relationship manager in Kota, has been arrested for allegedly embezzling Rs 4.6 crore from 110 accounts between 2020 and 2023. She manipulated account details, rerouting transaction alerts and OTPs to her relatives while making unauthorized stock market investments.

title: PM Modi: Govt initiatives over 11 years helped farmers prosper
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi highlighted the transformation of the agriculture sector over the past 11 years, emphasizing increased farmer prosperity through initiatives like PM-Kisan and improved MSP. Agricultural exports have surged, and access to affordable finance has expanded significantly. The government's focus on soil health, irrigation, and crop insurance has bolstered foodgrain production and secured farmer incomes.

title: A PG medic wanted to skip a seminar. So she issued a hoax bomb threat
content: Mangaluru police apprehended Chalasani Monica Choudary, a postgraduate medical student, for orchestrating a hoax bomb threat to a private hospital. The incident occurred on June 4th, with Choudary intending to evade a seminar presentation. Ironically, she also filed a complaint about the threat, but technical analysis exposed her involvement, leading to her arrest and the seizure of her mobile phone.

title: India a must at G7 table: Mark Carney on inviting PM Modi
content: Canadian PM Mark Carney defended inviting Narendra Modi to the G7 summit, citing India's economic significance and its role in global supply chains. Despite ongoing concerns regarding the Hardeep Singh Nijjar case, Carney highlighted progress in law enforcement dialogue, emphasizing Canada's commitment to the rule of law.

title: Once a rebel, always a rebel? Congress's Tharoor dilemma
content: Shashi Tharoor, a prominent figure in the Congress party, has often challenged the party's high command, advocating for internal reforms and questioning his role within the organization. His actions, including contesting the presidential election and publicly praising government policies, have created friction with party leaders.

title: Tapping out: Kabul may become first modern city to run out of water; crisis looms, warns report
content: Kabul is facing a severe water crisis, potentially becoming the first modern city to completely run out of water. Groundwater extraction far exceeds natural replenishment, with aquifers projected to dry up by 2030, potentially displacing millions. Contamination, infrastructure issues, and climate change exacerbate the problem, forcing families into debt.

title: FBI chief Kash Patel reveals how India is helping America with fentanyl crisis
content: Patel said that he had personally reached out to Indian officials and that joint operations between the FBI and Indian law enforcement were now underway. ‚ÄúI literally just got off the phone with the Indian government,‚Äù he said. ‚ÄúI said, I need your help. This stuff‚Äôs coming into your country and then they‚Äôre moving it from your country because India is not consuming fentanyl.‚Äù

title: HC: Pay pensioner‚Äôs full claim for heart transplant at pvt hosp
content: The Bombay High Court ruled that a retired central government employee, Anirudh Nansi, is entitled to full reimbursement for his heart transplant at a private hospital. The court emphasized the urgency of the procedure and the lack of timely availability in empanelled hospitals. It deemed the denial of reimbursement a violation of fundamental rights, ordering payment within four weeks.

title: Tesla CEO teases 'The America Party' even as he backs down in battle with US prez
content: Elon Musk teased the possibility of forming a new political party in America, even as he retreated from his feud with Donald Trump by deleting posts linking him to Jeffrey Epstein. This climbdown occurred after Trump threatened to cut off federal loans and subsidies to Musk's companies.

title: Bengaluru stampede: Compensation raised to Rs 25 lakh; KSCA secretary resigns
content: Following the tragic stampede at the RCB victory celebration that resulted in 11 deaths, Karnataka CM Siddaramaiah has increased compensation to Rs 25 lakh per family. A retired HC judge will lead an inquiry into the incident, while two KSCA officials have resigned, taking moral responsibility. The government aims to prevent future occurrences through thorough investigation and cooperation.

title: 'Evasive notes': Rahul hits back after EC's rebuttal on 'polls rigged' claim
content: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi has intensified his criticism of the Election Commission of India (ECI), demanding answers to his allegations of election "match-fixing." This comes after the ECI refuted his claims as "completely absurd." Gandhi insists on the release of consolidated voter rolls and CCTV footage from Maharashtra polling booths to prove transparency.

title: Amarnath Yatra to begin on July 3; 3.3L pilgrims registered so far
content: Over 331,000 devotees have already registered for the Amarnath Yatra, commencing on July 3 and concluding on August 9, 2025. Lieutenant Governor Manoj Sinha chaired a meeting to review preparations, focusing on essential amenities and safety measures along the Pahalgam and Baltal routes. The board discussed enhancing facilities, lodging, and services for a hassle-free pilgrimage.

title: Srinagar‚Äôs Jamia Masjid locked on Eid, Mirwaiz detained
content: On Eid-ul-Adha, Srinagar's Jamia Masjid was locked, and Mirwaiz Umar Farooq was placed under house arrest, preventing devotees from offering prayers, which sparked criticism from various political figures, including Omar Abdullah. Anjuman Auqaf Jamia Masjid Srinagar reported the mosque's closure and police deployment. Mirwaiz Umar Farooq expressed his dismay over the continued restrictions on religious practices in the Muslim-majority region.

title: To succeed at Western Kentucky, Tyson Helton seeks gunslingers
content: western Kentucky head coach Tyson Helton evaluates a quarterback . he says he wants a player completely unaffected by the moment . "there's not one damn great quarterback who don't walk up there like John Wayne," helton says .

title: Tummala terms Eatala Rajender‚Äôs remarks on Kaleshwaram as ‚Äòmotivated and misleading‚Äô

title: Tyrese Haliburton has made the leap, and the Thunder should be terrified
content: the Pacers beat the Oklahoma City Thunder 111-110 in game 1 of the NBA Finals . he hit the shot with 0.3 seconds remaining in the game . the homage to Reggie Miller has taken place over the past few weeks .

title: USWNT's Lavelle returns after long injury absence
content: u.s. women's national team midfielder rose Lavelle played her first match in sixth months . lavelle underwent ankle surgery shortly after the match in 74th minute . "it was definitely a lot harder than I anticipated," she said .

title: Texas softball's journey from heartbreak to hoisting the national championship trophy
content: the Texas Longhorns walked out in a two-game sweep to Oklahoma . the longhorns won their second WCWS national championship series in three years . a grand slam was issued by infielder estelle Czech .

title: Why Vasiliy Lomachenko was different from the rest
content: vasiliy Lomachenko announced his retirement from boxing on friday at age 37 . he leaves the sport as a three-division world champion with a professional record of 18-3 (12 KOs) a new wave of fans will look at his record and ask how a fighter with three losses in only 21 fights can be considered great .

title: With French Open title, Coco Gauff's time is now
content: Coco Gauff wins first major win of the year at the french open . she outlasts Sabalenka to win 1st french Open 7h Simon Cambers . a year removed from her junior title at the French Open . the 15-year-old had just lost her childhood heroes .

title: How the spoils will get divided from NCAA settlement
content: university of Alabama athletic director Greg Byrne has worked in college athletics for over three decades . he's seen it all, at least until late Friday night, when he began officially facing a new challenge . the settlement allows athletic departments to pay out about $20.5 million directly to their players .

title: Juan Soto, the showman, has finally shown up -- is he about to go on a tear?
content: the new york Mets gave him the richest contract in sports history . he won with enthralling walks, commanding attention as much between pitches as during the action . soto shook his head and strutted his hips and he Soto Shuffled .

title: MLB Power Rankings: Are the Dodgers or Tigers No. 1 this week?
content: the Detroit Tigers have retaken the no. 1 spot and are one of four AL teams in the top 10 in week 10 . the national league is still well-represented at the top of our list . a number of clubs have continued their fall down our rankings this week .

title: Woman killed, five injured in road accident in Tiruvannamalai
content: e-Paper The View From India Looking at World Affairs from the Indian perspective . the driver of the vehicle has been charged with driving a car accident . police say the driver is responsible for the crash . he is charged with aggravated battery and causing a serious injury .

title: UFC 316: Dvalishvili submits O'Malley in rematch to retain bantamweight title
content: both the men's and women's bantamweight belts will be on the line at UFC 316 from newark, new jersey, on Saturday (10 p.m. ET on ESPN PPV . prelims at 8 p, and early prelim games at 6 p . a rematch against Sean O'Malley (18-2) will be held in the main event .

title: The Thunder's five-step plan to avoid a 2-0 NBA Finals hole
content: the Oklahoma City Thunder forced 25 turnovers in Game 1 of the NBA Finals . their star point guard scored 38 points, 24 more than their opponent's star guard . the Indiana Pacers went into Oklahoma City and stole Game 1 by a 111-110 score .
